zone.line: To the Earth, Mother of all
O universal Mother, who dost keep
Eldest of things, great Earth, I sing of thee.
All shapes that have their dwelling in the sea,
All things that fly, or on the ground divine
Live, move, & there are nourished — these are
These from thy wealth thou dost sustain — from thee
Fair babes are born, & fruits on every tree
The life of mortal men beneath thy sway
Is held; thy power both gives & takes away
Happy are them whom thy mild favors nourish
All things unstinted round thee grow &
